title: 106_hr3381
content: The "Export Enhancement Act of 1999" is cited in Section 1. Section 2 amends the OPIC issuing authority by changing the year from 1999 to 2003. Section 3 addresses the impact of OPIC programs. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include new requirements related to environmental impact assessments for proposed actions by the Corporation's Board of Directors. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include new requirements for environmental impact assessments by the Corporation's Board of Directors. The amendments also mandate public availability of assessments and public hearings before each Board meeting. These changes will take effect 90 days after the enactment of the Act. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include new requirements for environmental impact assessments by the Corporation's Board of Directors. The amendments also mandate public availability of assessments and public hearings before each Board meeting. These changes will take effect 90 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF OPIC. Section 233(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include new members on the Board of Directors, such as the President of the Corporation, the Administrator of the Agency for International Development, and the United States Trade Representative. The United States Trade Representative may designate a Deputy to serve on the Board. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include a Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Board, designated by the President from among the Directors, excluding those appointed under specific conditions. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include a Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Board for the Trade and Development Agency, designated by the President from among the Directors. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to emphasize economic sectors with US export potential like energy, transportation, telecommunications, and environment. The Trade and Development Agency will now require corporations to share costs and reimburse funds for project planning services. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to provide funding of $48,000,000 for fiscal year 2000 and subsequent years for project implementation by corporations or entities. SEC. 6. Implementation of primary objectives of TPCC. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is responsible for reporting on efforts to eliminate overlap in Federal export promotion activities, coordinating trade shows, working with State and national organizations, promoting better coordination between different levels of export promotion activities, and providing annual reports on these actions. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is responsible for reporting on efforts to eliminate overlap in Federal export promotion activities, coordinating trade shows, working with State and national organizations, promoting better coordination between different levels of export promotion activities, and providing annual reports on these actions, including matters addressed in paragraphs (1), (2), (3), and (4) in the annual report required under the Export Enhancement Act of 1988. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is responsible for reporting on efforts to eliminate overlap in Federal export promotion activities and providing annual reports on these actions. Section 2312(f) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 is amended to change the timing of TPCC reports to March 30 of each year.
